intro: Alsophila goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazensis tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery fronds. The plant exhibits a unique combination of primitive and advanced features in its reproductive structures. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and contributing to the biodiversity of its native region.
